page.title: 11LAW AND ORDER CRIME
page.content: In Malpas there is not much crime. What crime there is falls into two catergories: 1. Theft. These are mainly minor burglaries committed by youths. 2. Poaching of live stock from the many farms in the area. This is very serious crime as the farmers stand to lose a great deal of money. At Malpas POLICE STATION there are two cells in which captured criminals can be locked up. However these are hardly ever used and any one who needes to be locked up is taken to Chester police sttion. The poice constables work mainly on the beat and spend very liitle time inside the police station. Constable Evans visits the locl school regularly to talk to the children and to get to know them. This is called community policing.
